nodes.text: Tatooine Sunset was a beverage made with tea and fermented fruit. The drink was suitable for human consumption and named after the sunsets of the planet Tatooine.

Tatooine Sunsets were available with alcohol at Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina in the city of Mos Eisley on Tatooine. Around 34 ABY, non-alcoholic Tatooine Sunsets were available for purchase at Ronto Roasters in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was one of the signature drinks of Bakkar, a butcher from Tatooine and the owner of Ronto Roaster's. Eloc Throno, the author of Traveler's Guide to Batuu recommended the drink with a touch of desert pear.

Tatooine Sunset was first mentioned in the 2015 reference book Star Wars: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know. The drink is available for guests to purchase at the Ronto Roasters food stall in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. The menu's description at both parks includes Gold Peak unsweetened tea, melon, and blueberry. The Disneyland version uses lemonade by Odwalla, while Disney's Hollywood Studios uses Minute Maid. Although depicted as orange-colored on menu photographs, the actual beverage is brown.
